com.iqu.sdk

Class IQUSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iqu.sdk.IQUSDK

  • public class IQUSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    IQUSDK is a class that encapsulates the IQU SDK and offers various methods and properties to communicate with the IQU server.

    All public methods in IQU SDK are thread safe.

    Quick start

    1. Methods and properties can be accessed trough the static instance() method.
    2. Call start(Application, String, String), start(Application, String, String, boolean), start(Application, String, String, String) or start(Application, String, String, String, boolean) to start the IQU SDK.
    3. Add additional Ids via setFacebookId(String), setGooglePlusId(String), setTwitterId(String) or setCustomId(String).
    4. Start calling analytic tracking methods to send messages to the server.
    5. Update the payable property to indicate the player is busy with a payable action.
    6. The IQU SDK needs to be notified when the application is minimized to the background, is activated from the background or is getting destroyed. Call pause() from within the Activity.onPause() method and resume() from the Activity.onResume() method. Call destroy() from within the Activity.onDestroy() method.

    Network communication

    The IQU SDK uses a separate thread to send messages to the server (to prevent blocking the main thread). This means that there might be a small delay before messages are actually sent to the server. The maximum delay is determined by the updateInterval property.

    If the SDK fails to send a message to the IQU server, messages are queued and are sent when the server is available again. The queued messages are stored in persistent storage so they still can be resent after an application restart.

    Ids

    The SDK supports various ids which are included with every tracking message sent to the server. See IQUIdType for the types supported by the SDK. Use getId(IQUIdType) to get an id value.

    Some ids are determined by the SDK itself, other ids must be set via one of the following methods: setFacebookId(String), setGooglePlusId(String), setTwitterId(String) or setCustomId(String)

    The SDK supports Google Play services and tries to obtain the advertising id and limited ad tracking setting. The SDK will disable the analytic methods if it successfully obtained the limit ad tracking value and the Android user turned this option on (see getAnalyticsEnabled()).

    The SDK does not use direct links to Google Play methods and classes but instead uses reflection to obtain the advertising ID and limit ad tracking. The SDK will not generate any errors if the Google Play jar files are not included within the application.

    Informational properties

    The IQU SDK offers the following informational properties:

    • getAnalyticsEnabled() indicates if the the analytics part of the IQU SDK is enabled. When the disabled, the trackXXXXX methods will not send messages. The analytics are disabled when the user enabled limit ad tracking with the Google Play services.
    • getServerAvailable() to get information if the messages were sent successfully or not.

    Testing

    The IQU SDK contains the following properties to help with testing the SDK:

    • logEnabled property to turn logging on or off.
    • log property which will be filled with messages from various methods.
    • testMode property to test the SDK without any server interaction or to simulate an offline situation with the server not being available.

    The IQUSDK.java file defines a DEBUG constant, if no testing is required this constant can be set to false to allow the compiler optimization to excluded debug specific code.

    Advance timing

    The IQU SDK offers several properties to adjust the various timings:

    • getUpdateInterval() property determines the time between the internal update calls.
    • getSendTimeout() property determines the maximum time sending a message to the server may take.
    • getCheckServerInterval() property determines the time between checks for server availability. If sending of data fails, the update thread will wait the time, as set by this property, before trying to send the data again.

        aSecretKey - Secret key

      • start

        public void start(Application anApplication,
                  java.lang.String anApiKey,
                  java.lang.String aSecretKey,
                  boolean aPayable)
        Starts the SDK using and sets the payable property to the specified value.

        If the SDK is already started, another call to this method will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        anApplication - Application using the SDK
        anApiKey - API key
        aSecretKey - Secret key
        aPayable - Initial payable value

      • start

        public void start(Application anApplication,
                  java.lang.String anApiKey,
                  java.lang.String aSecretKey,
                  java.lang.String aCustomId)
        Calls start(Application,String,String,String,boolean) with true for payable parameter.
        Parameters:
        anApplication - Application using the SDK
        anApiKey - API key
        aSecretKey - Secret key
        aCustomId - A custom id that the SDK should use.

      • start

        public void start(Application anApplication,
                  java.lang.String anApiKey,
                  java.lang.String aSecretKey,
                  java.lang.String aCustomId,
                  boolean aPayable)
        Calls start(Application, String, String, boolean) and then calls setCustomId(String) to store aCustomId.

        If the SDK is already started, another call to this method will only update the custom id.

        Parameters:
        anApplication - Application using the SDK
        anApiKey - API key
        aSecretKey - Secret key
        aCustomId - A custom id that the SDK should use.
        aPayable - Initial payable value

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Call this method from Activity's onPause; it pauses the internal update thread and saves local storage to persistent storage.

        It will wait for the update thread to finish if a call to update is active.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Call this method from Activity's onResume; it resumes the update thread.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        This method stops the update thread and destroys the current IQU instance.

        Accessing instance() after call to this method will create a new IQU instance. start(Application,String,String) needs to be called again to initialize the new instance.

        This method must be called from the Activity's onDestroy method. If this does not happen the IQU instance might stay active including the update thread.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId(IQUIdType aType)
        Return id for a certain type. If the id is not known (yet), the method will return an empty string.
        Parameters:
        aType - Type to get id for.
        Returns:
        stored id value or empty string if it not (yet) known.

      • trackRevenue

        public void trackRevenue(float anAmount,
                         java.lang.String aCurrency,
                         java.lang.String aReward)
        Tracks payment made by the user.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        anAmount - Amount
        aCurrency - Currency code (ISO 4217 standard)
        aReward - Name of reward or null if there no such value

      • trackRevenue

        public void trackRevenue(float anAmount,
                         java.lang.String aCurrency)
        Tracks revenue, just calls trackRevenue(float, String, String) with null for aReward.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        anAmount - Amount
        aCurrency - Currency code (ISO 4217 standard)

      • trackRevenue

        public void trackRevenue(float anAmount,
                         java.lang.String aCurrency,
                         float aVirtualCurrencyAmount,
                         java.lang.String aReward)
        Tracks payment made by the user including an amount in a virtual currency.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        anAmount - Amount
        aCurrency - Currency code (ISO 4217 standard)
        aVirtualCurrencyAmount - Amount of virtual currency rewarded with this purchase
        aReward - Name of reward or null if there no such value

      • trackRevenue

        public void trackRevenue(float anAmount,
                         java.lang.String aCurrency,
                         float aVirtualCurrencyAmount)
        Tracks revenue, just calls trackRevenue(float, String, float, String) with null for aReward.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        anAmount - Amount
        aCurrency - Currency code (ISO 4217 standard)
        aVirtualCurrencyAmount - Amount of virtual currency rewarded with this purchase

      • trackItemPurchase

        public void trackItemPurchase(java.lang.String aName)
        Tracks an item purchase.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aName - Name of item

      • trackItemPurchase

        public void trackItemPurchase(java.lang.String aName,
                              float aVirtualCurrencyAmount)
        Tracks an item purchase including amount in virtual currency.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aName - Name of item
        aVirtualCurrencyAmount - Amount of virtual currency rewarded with this purchase

      • trackTutorial

        public void trackTutorial(java.lang.String aStep)
        Tracks tutorial progression achieved by the user.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aStep - Step name or number of the tutorial.

      • trackMilestone

        public void trackMilestone(java.lang.String aName,
                           java.lang.String aValue)
        Tracks a milestone achieved by the user, e.g. if the user achieved a level.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aName - Milestone name
        aValue - Value of the milestone

      • trackMarketing

        public void trackMarketing(java.lang.String aPartner,
                           java.lang.String aCampaign,
                           java.lang.String anAd,
                           java.lang.String aSubId,
                           java.lang.String aSubSubId)
        Tracks a marketing source. All parameters are optional, if a value is not known null must be used.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aPartner - Marketing partner name or null if there is none.
        aCampaign - Marketing campaign name or null if there is none.
        anAd - Marketing ad name or null if there is none.
        aSubId - Marketing partner sub id or null if there is none.
        aSubSubId - Marketing partner sub sub id or null if there is none.

      • trackUserAttribute

        public void trackUserAttribute(java.lang.String aName,
                               java.lang.String aValue)
        Tracks an user attribute, e.g. gender or birthday.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aName - Name of the user attribute, e.g. gender
        aValue - Value of the user attribute, e.g. female

      • trackCountry

        public void trackCountry(java.lang.String aCountry)
        Tracks the country of the user, only required for S2S implementations.

        If the IQU SDK has not been initialized or getAnalyticsEnabled() returns false, this method will do nothing.

        Parameters:
        aCountry - Country as specified in ISO3166-1 alpha-2, e.g. US, NL, DE

      • instance

        public static IQUSDK instance()
        Gets the singleton IQU instance. If no instance exists a new instance will be created.
        Returns:
        singleton IQU instance.

      • getInstance

        public static IQUSDK getInstance()
        Just calls the instance() method and returns its result.
        Returns:
        result from instance() call.

      • getAnalyticsEnabled

        public boolean getAnalyticsEnabled()
        Returns the analytics enabled state. When not enabled, all calls to the tracking methods are ignored and no messages are sent to the server.

        On Android devices the enabled state depends on the limit ad tracking. If the user turned on limit ad tracking, the analyticsEnabled property will return false.

        Returns:
        analytics enabled state

      • getInitialized

        public boolean getInitialized()
        Returns initialized state. After a call to start(Application, String, String) this property will return true.
        Returns:
        false until a start() method has been called.

      • getPayable

        public boolean getPayable()
        Returns if a payable event is active or not.

        The default value is true.

        Returns:
        payable active

      • setPayable

        public void setPayable(boolean aValue)
        Turns the enable event on or off.
        Parameters:
        aValue - New payable value.

      • getUpdateInterval

        public long getUpdateInterval()
        Returns the time in milliseconds to wait between update calls.

        Default value is 200.

        Returns:
        current updateInterval property value

      • setUpdateInterval

        public void setUpdateInterval(long aValue)
        Sets the updateInterval property. This new value will be used with the next wait call.

        This value determines the maximum delay between creating messages and sending them.

        Parameters:
        aValue - New value to use (minimum allowed value is 10, maximum allowed value is 60000).

      • getSendTimeout

        public long getSendTimeout()
        This property determines the maximum time in milliseconds sending a message to the IQU server is allowed to take.

        If there is no response by the IQU server within this time, the SDK assumes the server is not reachable and will set the serverAvailable property to false .

        Default value is 20000 (20 seconds).

        Returns:
        current sendTimeout property value

      • setSendTimeout

        public void setSendTimeout(long aValue)
        Changes the sendTimout property value. The minimum value allowed is 100.
        Parameters:
        aValue - New value to use.

      • getCheckServerInterval

        public long getCheckServerInterval()
        This property determines the time between server availability checks in milliseconds.

        This property is used once the sending of a message fails. The checkServerInterval property determines the time the SDK waits before checking the availability of the server and trying to resend the messages.

        The default value is 2000 (2 seconds).

        Returns:
        interval time for server check

      • setCheckServerInterval

        public void setCheckServerInterval(long aValue)
        Changes the checkServerInterval property. The minimum value allowed is 100.
        Parameters:
        aValue - New value to use.

      • getLogEnabled

        public boolean getLogEnabled()
        Gets the current log enabled value.
        Returns:
        current log enabled value.

      • setLogEnabled

        public void setLogEnabled(boolean aValue)
        Turns the log on or off. When turned on, various IQU SDK methods will add information to the log property.

        The current log will be cleared when turning off the logging.

        Parameters:
        aValue - Use true to logging on, false to turn logging off.

      • getLog

        public java.lang.String getLog()
        Gets the current log.
        Returns:
        full log.

      • getServerAvailable

        public boolean getServerAvailable()
        Returns the sever availability state. The state is updated when messages are sent to the server.

        While the server is not available, messages will be queued to be sent once the server is available again.

        If the server is not available and there are pending messages, the class will check the server availability at regular intervals. Once the server becomes available again, the messages are sent to the server.

        Returns:
        true when the last message was sent successful or false if the message could not be sent.

      • getTestMode

        public IQUTestMode getTestMode()
        Gets the current test mode property value.

        The default value is IQUTestMode.NONE

        Returns:
        current test mode.

      • setTestMode

        public void setTestMode(IQUTestMode aValue)
        Sets the test mode property. The test mode property can be used during development.

        Use IQUTestMode.SIMULATE_SERVER to prevent any network traffic.

        Use IQUTestMode.SIMULATE_OFFLINE to test the SDK behaviour while the server is not available.

        To go back to normal operation use IQUTestMode.NONE.

        Parameters:
        aValue - New test mode to use.
